Show films sorted by title
To show all films you only need to open the application. When you open the application the first view shows you all films sorted by their title. You can scroll up and down.

If you are on other view, open the navigation menu and select "Films (by title)".

Show films sorted by year
To show all films sorted by year, and show different details of these, you only need to open the application. Once opened, you need to open the navigation drawer or application menu and select "Films (by year)" option

In order to delete a film you need to go to \"Films\" (ordered by title or by date) and select the film you want to delete. In the detailed view, a bin button will appear to delete that film. Click and confirm to finish.

In order to add a new film, you need to use the round button shown in both the sorted by title and by year films list.

A form will be shown, asking for the different film details. Once you have introduced "Title", "Country" (with autocompletion feature), "Year", "Director" and "Actor", you will be able to press the "next" button.

Finally, you will be asked for a description about the film and a rate (selectable stars), and then be able to press the "done" button.

In order to change a film rating you need to go to \"Films\" (ordered by title or by date) and select a film. In the detailed view, you will be able to change the selectable stars to change the rating of that film. After that a popup will appear to confirm your change.

In order to search all films with an actor you need to go to "Films" (ordered by title or by date) and click on the search icon at the top right corner.
Afterwards, introduce the actor you want to search for and confirm on your keyboard.
Then the filter applies showing you all films having an actor containing the text you have searched.

The search does not take care of text case.

Note that if you add a new film with the filter activated this film only will appear on the list if matches with the search.

You can remove the search filter to show all films again closing the search bar or moving to another view via the navigation menu.
